util.logging

Class AbstractLogger

  • java.lang.Object
    • util.logging.AbstractLogger
  • Deprecated. 
    Since the Logger implements neither a interface nor an abstract class.

    @Deprecated
public abstract class AbstractLogger
extends Object
    The AbstractLogger describes the interface for util.logging loggers.

    This class is a wrapper class around the Logger class of java.util.logging API. It masks several log methods to more intuitive names and hides other methods to stay simple.

    The following java.util.logging.Logger methods are masked:

    • loggingLogger is masked by Logger.error(String)
    • Logger.warning(String) is masked by Logger.warn(String)
    Additionally AbstractLoggers can log on LevelX.DEBUG log level, a level between Level.CONFIG and Level.FINE.

    Author:
    Loris
    See Also:
    Logger, Level, LevelX

        public String getName()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns the name of the internal java.util.logging.Logger name. This method gets forwarded to Logger.getName() and returns the method's return value.
        Returns:
        The name of the logger.
        See Also:
        Logger.getName()
